results.title: Heathers
results.creator_credit: Michael Lehmann, Denise Di Novi, Cinemarque Entertainment and New World Pictures
results.brief_description: This black comedy about high school politics, teenage suicide and trendy cliques, focuses on the ‘Heathers’, three of the prettiest and most popular rich girls at Westerbury High School, home of preppies, nerds and trendies. They set the trends, make the rules and devise ways of making life hell for the other students. That is until Heather No.4 who is really a Veronica, (Winona Ryder), teams up with her boyfriend, JD, a rebellious new student (Christian Slater), to change all the rules and seek revenge. An ultimate revenge fantasy which has become a “cult” movie. Also stars Shannen Doherty.

results.title: The Journey of Natty Gann
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Kagan, Mike Lobell and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: America is in the depths of the Great Depression. Families are broken apart when far away jobs beckon. A courageous young girl confronts overwhelming odds when she embarks on a cross-country search for her father. During her extraordinary odyssey, she forms a close bond with a magnificent protective wolf, and a hardened drifter. Stars Meredith Salenger, John Cusack, Ray Wise, Laine Kazan.

results.title: The Ladykillers
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, Sir Michael Balcon, Michael Balcon Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A black comedy from the Ealing Studios which features Alec Guinness and Peter Sellers. An innocent little old lady who takes in a sinister lodger finds out that he and four friends have committed a robbery. Once they realise she knows everything, they plot to kill her. However, just because she is the archetypal genteel old lady pensioner, doesn’t mean that she is quite as harmless as she seems. Also stars Jack Warner, Katie Johnson and Frankie Howerd.

results.title: Legend
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Arnon Milchan and Legend Productions
results.brief_description: Legend is a fairytale produced on a grand scale, set in a timeless world peopled with fairies, elves, goblins, trolls and demons. It is the story of Jack (Tom Cruise), a young heroic peasant who takes his sweetheart, the beautiful princess Lili (Mia Sara), to see the most powerful creatures on earth, the last surviving unicorns. Unknown to the young lovers, Darkness (Satan) played to perfection by Tim Curry is using the innocence of Lili to set a trap to capture and destroy the creatures of light, the golden-horned unicorns. Children of all ages will be entranced by the magnificent make-up effects, from the smallest elves to the giant Darkness. The latter is unquestionably the most impressive depiction of Satan ever brought to the screen. It is a classic story of good and evil, love and hate.

results.title: Juliet of the spirits = Giulietta degli spiriti
results.creator_credit: Federico Fellini, Clemente Fracassi, Francoriz Production and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: A kaleidoscope of fantasy about a bored middle-class woman (Giuletta Masina) who discovers she can conjure up spirits each representing a repressed desire or restrained impulse in her nature. The spirits, apparitions in various guises, provide Fellini with the perfect opportunity to exercise his strong sense of the fantastic and the bizarre.

results.title: A Tale of springtime = Conte de printemps
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Margaret Menegoz and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Tales of the four seasons = Contes des quatre saisons”.
The first in a series of films by Eric Rohmer based on the four seasons, “Le Conte de printemps” is essentially a chamber piece about the interaction of six characters (one of whom never appears). The characters are made up of three couples, whose centre is the developing friendship between the cerebral Jeanne and the instinctive Natasha. Rohmer’s visual style is restrained and unobtrusive, but also gloriously cinematic. There are flowers blooming everywhere, signs of rebirth, of hope, of the opportunites that life has to offer, and teasingly, the possibilities that lie just beyond the grasp of the flawed humanity that populates this film. Cast includes Anne Teyssedre, Hugues Quester, Florence Darel, Eloise Bennett, Sophie Robin.

results.title: Love and death
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Charles H. Joffe and Jack Rollins & Charles H. Joffe Productions
results.brief_description: Who else but Woody Allen would invade the land and spirit of Tolstoy and have audiences laughing all over the world? Meet Boris Grushenko (Allen), the son of a farmer in the Eighteenth Century Russia in hot pursuit of the meaning of life… and his sultry cousin Sonja (Diane keaton). Along the way, such soul-searching questions are posed as “if Christ was a carpenter, what would he charge for bookshelves?” and perhaps more importantly “Are there girls after death?” Boris reluctantly enlists during the Napoleonic Wars. Hilarious twists of fate lead Boris into battle, inadvertant heroism, bedroom escapades and a scheme to kill Napoleon himself. With its visually impressive and historical setting, this film is a comedy of epic proportions. Also stars Jessica Harper. Written by Woody Allen.

results.title: Judgment at Nuremberg
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This is an epic re-creation of the famous Nazi judicial trial, featuring an extraordinary international cast which includes Spencer Tracy, Richard Widmark, Marlene Dietrich, Judy Garland, Maximillian Schell, Montgomery Clift and Burt Lancaster. Capturing twelve Academy Award nominations including Best Picture, the film won Oscars for Best Actor (Schell) and Best Screenplay. In this stirring courtroom drama, acclaimed producer/director Stanely Kramer dared to ask one of the most emotionally charged questions of our century: who was responsible for the Holocaust? The story centres on the trial of four Nazi judges accused of war crimes, men who willingly distorted the law to perpetuate the greatest atrocity ever committed against humanity. Judgment at Nuremberg has galvanised audiences around the world with its poignant historical commentary, riveting entertainment and compelling performances.

results.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Michael Truman, Michael Balcon Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
When an antiquated railway line is threatened with closure, the villagers decide to run it themselves, entering into frenzied competition with the local bus route. Stanley Holloway as Mr Valentine, the village soak, becomes the railway benefactor and sets the wheels in motion. The antics of this eccentric rural community will provide a comic treat, while train lovers will appreciate the quest to save an old steam engine.

results.title: Autumn sonata
results.brief_description: The reunion of an internationally famous concert pianist and her married daughter begins on a hopeful note, but too many old hurts and bitter memories conflict with their love for each other. Long-buried resentments between mother and daughter soon explode in a shattering confrontation of painful truths. Starring Ingrid Bergman and Liv Ullman.
